fifteenpuzzle

Class FifteenPuzzleFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • fifteenpuzzle.FifteenPuzzleFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class FifteenPuzzleFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Swing implementation of the popular "fifteen puzzle." The 4 x 4 board contains 15 numbered cells and one blank cell. The object is to repeatedly slide a numbered cell into an adjacent blank cell until the cells are organized in ascending order. -excerpt taken from Dr. Dan Everett's JavaDoc for FifteenPuzzleFrame
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  FifteenPuzzleFrame.ClickHandler
      Handles all mouse clicks in the Fifteen Puzzle, either by swapping the tiles or by displaying an error dialog -excerpt taken from Dr.
      (package private) class  FifteenPuzzleFrame.ExitAction
      Exits the game if the user implements this action
      (package private) class  FifteenPuzzleFrame.ShuffleTiles
      Implements the "Shuffle Tiles" operation in the Fifteen Puzzle -excerpt taken from Dr.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected int indexOf(java.lang.String tileLabel)
      Returns the number of the tile label on the game board
      protected boolean isAdjacentToBlankCell(java.lang.String tileLabel)
      Returns true if the tile labeled 'tileLabel' is adjacent to the blank tile -excerpt taken from Dr.
      protected boolean isInWinningConfiguration()
      Returns true if gameBoard is in the winning configuration (tiles 1 - 15 in order and blank tile at lower-right corner, returning false otherwise) -excerpt taken from Dr.
      private void layoutBoard()
      Adds the tiles to the game board -excerpt taken from Dr.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Draw the game board and instruct the user via a dialog box -excerpt taken from Dr.
      protected Position positionOf(java.lang.String tileLabel)
      Returns the Position of the tile with label 'tileLabel' -excerpt taken from Dr.
      private void shuffleDraw()
      Redraws the frame with the new shuffled configuration - only to be used after a shuffling of the tiles has occurred
      protected void shuffleTiles()
      Order tiles in an ordering differing from the solution configuration by fourteen randomly chosen transpositions of the numbered tiles (not moving the blank tile from position (3,3)) -excerpt taken from Dr.
      protected void transpose(int source, int target)
      Swap the labels of tile['source'] and tile['target'] in array 'tile' -excerpt taken from Dr.
